required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of rTMS Over the Left DLPFC on Language Switching
clinical_study.official_title: Impact of Repetitive Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation Over the Left Dorsolateral Prefrontal Cortex on Language Switching and Cognitive Flexibility

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate whether theta burst stimulation (TBS) over the left dorsolateral prefrontal cortex (DLPFC) influences language switching and cognitive flexibility. The experimental paradigm will assess the impact of inhibitory and excitatory prefrontal stimulation by TBS versus sham-TBS over the DLPFC in healthy bilinguals.

detailed_description.textblock:
Background:
Clinical observations and neuroimaging studies seem to confirm the role of executive functions and frontal structures in language processing in bilingual subjects.
Repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation, such as for example theta burst stimulation (TBS), is increasingly being used as a valuable tool for neuroscientists investigating the underlying mechanisms of cognitive functions. Case studies have shown a change in language switching after bilingual patients received repetitive magnetic stimulation to the left DLPFC. However, there is no study investigating the effect of TBS applied to the DLPFC on language switching in healthy participants.
Procedure:
A planned total of 40 unbalaced bilingual participants will be included. Half of the participants will receive inhibitory theta burst stimulation (continuous TBS), the other half excitatory theta burst stimulation (intermittent TBS). After TBS, different language and nonverbal tasks will be performed while an EEG is measured. Before being stimulated, each subject will conduct the same tasks with a sham-TBS as a baseline measure.

primary_outcome.description: Picture naming alternated in English and German. Speech onset times & accuracy will be recorded and analyzed

secondary_outcome.description: Picture naming in English. Speech onset times & accuracy will be recorded and analyzed
nonverbal switching task. Reaction times will be measured and analyzed.
Phonological fluency. Number of words starting with a given letter within 1 minute will be measured
Picture naming in German. Speech onset times & accuracy will be recorded and analyzed

other_outcome.description: 5-point test. Number of unique patterns produced within 1 minute.
During the picture naming, language switching and nonverbal switching tasks, an EEG will be recorded and ERPs in response to the stimuli measured and analyzed

arm_group.description: intermittent theta burst stimulation (iTBS) + Sham iTBS
continuous theta burst stimulation (cTBS) + Sham cTBS

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- L1 (Swiss)German, knowledge of English as a foreign language
- 18-45 years of age
- right-handedness
Exclusion Criteria:
- epilepsy / family history of epilepsy
- brain surgery, traumatic brain injuries
- cardiac pacemaker, metallic objects in the head
- history of neurological diseases or severe psychiatric disorders
- drug use (alcohol, psychoactive medication)
- strong headache
- pregnancy

facility.name: Laboratory for Cognitive and Neurological Sciences

reference.citation: Holtzheimer P, Fawaz W, Wilson C, Avery D. Repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation may induce language switching in bilingual patients. Brain Lang. 2005 Sep;94(3):274-7.
